info.title: TruffleHog
info.description:
TruffleHog API allows clients to manage sources and secrets. 

API requests require `X-Thog-Key` and `X-Thog-Secret` headers which can be generated at the `your-instance.trufflehog.org/api-keys`

get.description: List all secrets for all sources.

parameters.name: verified
parameters.description: Filters for secrets with the specified `verified` status

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A fuzzy search string that searches the secret location's email, source repository (if applicable), and source name entries, as well as the secret's type and redacted status

parameters.name: created_date_after
parameters.description: Filters secrets to include only those first discovered after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: created_date_before
parameters.description: Filters secrets to include only those first discovered before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: last_seen_after
parameters.description: Filters secrets to include only those last found in a scan after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: last_seen_before
parameters.description: Filters secrets to include only those last found in a scan before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: last_verified_after
parameters.description: Filters secrets to include only those last verified as live after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: last_verified_before
parameters.description: Filters secrets to include only those last verified as live before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the page number of the secrets to be displayed.

parameters.name: secret_locations__source__type
parameters.description:
Specifies one or more sources (comma-delimited if multiple) to filter by
  * `Github`
  * `Slack`
  * `ECR`
  * `Jira`
  * `S3`
  * `GCS`
  * `GitLab`
  * `Confluence`
  * `AzureStorage`
  * `CircleCI`
  * `Filesystem`
  * `GithubUnauthdRepo`
  * `GithubUnauthdOrg`
  * `PypiUnauthdPackages`
  * `NpmUnauthdPackages`
  * `Docker`
  * `BitBucket`
  * `S3Unauthed`
  * `PublicGit`
  * `Buildkite`
  * `Git`
  * `Gerrit`
  * `Jenkins`
  * `Teams`
  * `Artifactory`
  * `PublicEventMonitoring`
  * `SlackRealtime`
  * `GCSUnauthed`
  * `Sharepoint`
  * `GoogleDrive`

parameters.name: secret_locations__source__id
parameters.description: Specifies the source ID to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__source__scanner_group__id
parameters.description: Specifies the scanner ID to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__repository
parameters.description: Specifies the repository value to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__bucket
parameters.description: Specifies the bucket value to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__space
parameters.description: Specifies the Confluence space value to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__image
parameters.description: Specifies the Docker image name value to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__channel
parameters.description: Specifies the Slack or Teams channel name to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__workspace
parameters.description: Specifies the Bitbucket workspace name to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__package
parameters.description: Specifies the NPM or PyPi package name to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__account
parameters.description: Specifies the Azure Storage account name to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_locations__issue
parameters.description: Specifies the Jira issue to filter by.

parameters.name: secret_type
parameters.description: Specifies the secret type to filter by.

parameters.name: exclude_secret_type
parameters.description: Exclude secrets of the specified types (comma-delimited if multiple, case-insensitive)

parameters.name: triage_state
parameters.description: Specifies the triage state to filter by.

schema.description:
Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

parameters.name: has_no_last_verified
parameters.description: Specifies if results should only include secrets that have never been verified.

parameters.name: has_connection_issues
parameters.description: Specifies if results should only include secrets that have a connection issue from their last scan.

parameters.name: connection_issue_type
parameters.description: Specifies the connection issue type to filter by.

items.description: Describes the the connection error type a secret

verification_error_count.description: Number of secrets with the given filters that have verification errors

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the secret to be retrieved

triage_state.description:
Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the secret to be modified

post.description: Initiates reverification of a github secret.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the github secret to reverify.

400.description: Bad request, secret not verified or no GitHub locations found.

get.description: Checks the status of a secret's reverification.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the secret to check the reverification status.

status.description: Describes the reverification state of a secret * `pending` - A reverification job is already in progress. * `stale` - There are no pending or in progress reverification jobs.

404.description: Secret not found or not verified.

secret_ids.description: List of secret IDs to change the triage state to

triage_state.description:
Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

get.description: List all secret locations for all sources.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the page number of the secrets to be displayed

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page (max 250)

parameters.name: secret__id
parameters.description: Filters for secret locations related to a specific secret

parameters.name: created_date_after
parameters.description: Filter for secret locations created on or after this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: created_date_before
parameters.description: Filter for secret locations created on or before this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: modified_date_after
parameters.description: Filter for secret locations modified on or after this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: modified_date_before
parameters.description: Filter for secret locations modified on or before this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Order results by field (prefix with - for descending order)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the secret location to retrieve

get.description: Retrieve secret locations based on repository query with pagination.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query string to search in secret location repository.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

200.description: A paginated list of secret locations that match the query.

get.description: Retrieve comments on a specific secret.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Secret ID

get.description: Retrieve associated Analyze data for a given secret. This feature is in beta and may be subject to change.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Analyze ID

get.description: List issues with your TruffleHog instance

parameters.name: issue_state
parameters.description:
Specifies issue type (defaults to `ALL`)
  * `ACTIVE`
  * `SNOOZED`
  * `RESOLVED`
  * `ALL`

get.description: Retrieve specific issue with your TruffleHog instance

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Issue ID

get.description: List all secrets for all sources.

parameters.name: verified
parameters.description: Filters for secrets with the specified `verified` status

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the page number of the secrets to be displayed. NOTE: If a page is not specified, the results will not be paginated and `cur_page` and `total_pages` will not be returned

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Limits the number of items on a page (defaults to 100, ignored if `page` is not specified)

triage_state.description:
Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the secret to be modified

id.description: The ID of the updated secret

triage_state.description:
Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

get.description: Retrieves live secrets metrics within a specified date range.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for the metrics in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the metrics in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: ID of the source to filter the metrics.

parameters.name: num_dates
parameters.description: Number of evenly spaced dates to return between start_date and end_date.

404.description: No data found for the specified date range and source ID.

get.description: Retrieves time to rotate metrics within a specified date range.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for the metrics in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the metrics in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: ID of the source to filter the metrics.

404.description: No data found for the specified date range and source ID.

get.description: Get a list of all API keys.

post.description:
Generate a new API key given a name and optional expiration date.
If an expiration date is provided, it must be a future date.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The name and optional expiration date for the new API key.

name.description: The name for the new API key.

expiration_date.description: The optional expiration date for the new API key.

get.description: Get the details of a specific API key.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the API key to retrieve.

delete.description: Remove a specific API key from the system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the API key to delete.

get.description: Get a list of all configured notifiers.

post.description: Given a list of secret IDs, this endpoint will create notifications for each secret using the configured notifier. A maximum of 100 secret IDs can be processed in a single request.

secret_ids.description: List of secret IDs to create notifications for.

id.description: The unique ID of the API key.

name.description: The name of the API key.

key_id.description: The key ID of the API key.

expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the API key.

id.description: The unique ID of the API key.

name.description: The name of the API key.

key_id.description: The key ID of the API key.

secret.description: The secret associated with the API key.

expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the API key.

last_completed.description: Timestamp of the last completed scan

triage_state.description:
Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

Describes the the triage state of a secret as set by the customer
  * `UNTRIAGED` - A triage state has not been set (referred to as "active" in the UI)
  * `FALSE_POSITIVE` - The secret has been marked as a false positive (reffered to as "invalid" in the UI)
  * `RESOLVED` - The secret leak has been resolved
  * `WILL_NOT_FIX` - The secret leak has been confirmed, but will not be fixed

date_rotated.description: Our best estimate for when a secret was rotated -- identified by when the secret, which was once verified, is no longer verified.

next.description: URI of the next page of results.

previous.description: URI of the previous page of results.
